Calls the Amazon Chime SDK Identity RegisterAppInstanceUserEndpoint API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2022 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Registers an endpoint under an Amazon Chime AppInstanceUser. The endpoint receives messages for a user. For push notifications, the endpoint is a mobile device used to receive mobile push notifications for a user.
Boolean that controls whether the AppInstanceUserEndpoint is opted in to receive messages. ALL indicates the endpoint receives all messages. NONE indicates the endpoint receives no messages.
The idempotency token for each client request.
The device token for the GCM, APNS, and APNS_SANDBOX endpoint types.
The ARN of the resource to which the endpoint belongs.

The type of the AppInstanceUserEndpoint. Supported types: - APNS: The mobile notification service for an Apple device. - APNS_SANDBOX: The sandbox environment of the mobile notification service for an Apple device. - GCM: The mobile notification service for an Android device. Populate the ResourceArn value of each type as PinpointAppArn.
The VOIP device token for the APNS and APNS_SANDBOX endpoint types.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.ChimeSDKIdentity.Model.RegisterAppInstanceUserEndpointResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.ChimeSDKIdentity.Model.RegisterAppInstanceUserEndpointResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
Boolean that controls whether the AppInstanceUserEndpoint is opted in to receive messages. ALL indicates the endpoint receives all messages. NONE indicates the endpoint receives no messages.
The idempotency token for each client request.
The device token for the GCM, APNS, and APNS_SANDBOX endpoint types.
The VOIP device token for the APNS and APNS_SANDBOX endpoint types.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The ARN of the resource to which the endpoint belongs.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

The type of the AppInstanceUserEndpoint. Supported types: - APNS: The mobile notification service for an Apple device. - APNS_SANDBOX: The sandbox environment of the mobile notification service for an Apple device. - GCM: The mobile notification service for an Android device. Populate the ResourceArn value of each type as PinpointAppArn.

This cmdlet returns an Amazon.ChimeSDKIdentity.Model.RegisterAppInstanceUserEndpointResponse object containing multiple properties. The object can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
